name: House of Windsor Quiz | House of Windsor | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is the name of Princess Margaret's son?
questions.explanation:
David Armstrong-Jones.

	David Armstrong-Jones is the son of Princess Margaret and Anthony Armstrong-Jones, 1st Earl of Snowdon. After the death of his father in March 2016, he inherited his father's title and became the 2nd Earl of Snowdon.

questions.text: Where was Queen Elizabeth II born?
questions.explanation:
London.

	Bruton Street was the London home of her parents who were then still the Duke and Duchess of York.

questions.text: What are the names of Prince Andrew's daughters?
questions.explanation:
Beatrice and Eugenie.

	Beatrice was also the name of Queen Victoria's youngest daughter

questions.text: Where did Prince Charles attend university?
questions.explanation:
Cambridge.

	His younger brother Edward followed him to Cambridge.

questions.text: Ascot Racecourse is the personal property of the Queen.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Ascot Racecourse is part of the Windsor Estate owned by the Crown Estates. As such, it is owned by the Crown but it is not part of the reigning monarch's personal possessions. This arrangement dates back to the reign of George III who surrendered his rights to Crown Estates in exchange for a fixed income, known as the civil list.

questions.text: Which member of the Royal family lives at Gatcombe Park, Gloucestershire?
questions.explanation:
Princess Anne.

	Gatcombe Park is regularly used for equestrian events. Princess Anne is a former member of the UK Olympic equestrian team.

questions.text: Which Royal couple used to present the Wimbledon tennis trophies each year?
questions.explanation:
Duke and Duchess of Kent.

	The Duchess of Kent broke with protocol one year to hug Jana Novotna when the runner-up was weeping with disappointment.

questions.text: Prince Edward is patron and promoter of which sport?
questions.explanation:
Real Tennis.

	Prince Edward met his wife Sophie Rhys-Jones when she was working on the PR for Real Tennis

questions.text: What is the name of Princess Alexandra's husband?
questions.explanation:
Sir Angus Ogilvy.

	Princess Alexandra was the sister of the Duke of Kent and first cousin of the Queen.

questions.text: What nationality was the Duchess of Gloucester at birth?
questions.explanation:
Danish.

	Birgitte van Deurs met Prince Richard of Gloucester when they were both studying in Cambridge.
